column1: # DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE MANUALLY. IT WAS GENERATED BY ETL step 'covid/latest/covid#covid'.

column6: Estimated cumulative excess deaths during COVID-19
column7: For countries that have not reported all-cause mortality data for a given week, an estimate is shown, with uncertainty interval. If reported data is available, that value only is shown.
column11: For some countries, all-cause deaths and COVID-19 deaths use different date schemes, in which one refers to when the death occurred and the other to when it was reported. This difference could produce an artificial lag between the two time series.

column6: Estimated cumulative excess deaths per 100,000 people during COVID-19
column7: For countries that have not reported all-cause mortality data for a given week, an estimate is shown, with uncertainty interval. If reported data is available, that value only is shown. On the map, only the central estimate is shown.
column11: For some countries, all-cause deaths and COVID-19 deaths use different date schemes, in which one refers to when the death occurred and the other to when it was reported. This difference could produce an artificial lag between the two time series.

column6: Daily new confirmed COVID-19 cases & deaths per million people
column7: 7-day rolling average. Limited testing and challenges in the attribution of cause of death means the cases and deaths counts may not be accurate.

column3: Cases, hospital admissions, ICU patients, and deaths
column6: Confirmed COVID-19 cases, deaths, hospital admissions, and patients in ICU per million people
column7: Limited testing and challenges in the attribution of cause of death means the cases and deaths counts may not be accurate.

column6: COVID-19 vaccines administered, initial doses and boosters
column7: Total number of doses administered, broken down by whether they are part of the initial protocol or booster doses.

column6: COVID-19 vaccines administered per 100 people, initial doses and boosters
column7: Total number of doses administered, broken down by whether they are part of the initial protocol or booster doses, divided by the total population of the country.

column3: Vaccine doses, people vaccinated, and booster doses
column6: COVID-19 vaccine doses, people with at least one dose, people with a full initial protocol, and boosters per 100 people
COVID-19 vaccine doses and confirmed deaths
column7: Due to varying protocols and challenges in the attribution of the cause of death, the number of confirmed deaths may not accurately represent the true number of deaths caused by COVID-19.

column3: Vaccine doses, cases, ICU patients, and deaths
column6: COVID-19 vaccine doses, ICU patients, and confirmed cases and deaths
column7: Limited testing and challenges in the attribution of cause of death means the cases and deaths counts may not be accurate.
The share of analyzed sequences in the preceding two weeks that correspond to each variant group.
column11: This share may not reflect the complete breakdown of cases, since only a fraction of all cases are sequenced. Recently-discovered or actively-monitored variants may be overrepresented, as suspected cases of these variants are likely to be sequenced preferentially or faster than other cases.

column6: Share of SARS-CoV-2 sequences that are the delta variant
column7: Share of delta variant in all analyzed sequences in the last two weeks.

column6: Share of SARS-CoV-2 sequences that are the omicron variant
column7: Share of omicron variant in all analyzed sequences in the preceding two weeks.

column3: Cases, tests, positive and reproduction rate
column6: COVID-19 cases, tests, positive rate, and reproduction rate
column7: 7-day rolling average. Due to limited testing, the number of confirmed cases is lower than the true number of infections. Comparisons across countries are affected by differences in testing policies and reporting methods.
The stringency index is a composite measure based on nine response indicators including school closures, workplace closures, and travel bans, rescaled to a value from 0 to 100 (100 = strictest).
